text:
A photo posted by BeyoncÃ© (@beyonce) on Feb 1, 2017 at 10:39am PST 16 
BeyoncÃ© nearly broke the internet when she announced her pregnancy via an artsy photo uploaded to Instagram yesterday (February 1). 
While itâ€™s impossible to gauge exactly how many buckets of tears the haters cried, it has now been revealed that Beyâ€™s photo was the most-liked Instagram image ever. 
In the 21-or-so hours since it was posted, the image has been double-tapped 8.23 million times. Thatâ€™s enough to give it almost 2 million more likes than the image that previously held the record, a shot of actress-turned-popstar Selena Gomez drinking from a straw, which was uploaded last year. A photo posted by Selena Gomez (@selenagomez) on Jun 25, 2016 at 2:03pm PDT 
Despite being bumped by Beyâ€™s baby bump, Gomez still has Instagramâ€™s most followers (aside from the photo-sharing siteâ€™s own account), with 108 million to BeyoncÃ©â€™s 93.1 million. 
In addition to breaking Instagram records, BeyoncÃ© also made serious noise over on Twitter. According to Twitterâ€™s stat-tracking division, the singerâ€™s pregnancy announcement received half a million tweets in 45 minutes. Half a million Tweets about @Beyonce 's surprise #twins announcement. It's been 45 minutes. (Spiked at 17k Tweets per min.) ğŸ¼ğŸ¼

But that wasnâ€™t enough for Bey and the twins to break any Twitter records. 
To give you some context, Donald Trumpâ€™s presidential inauguration generated about 58,000 tweets per minute at its peak. BeyoncÃ©â€™s announcement spiked at 17,000 tweets per minute. 12 million Tweets have been sent so far today related to the #Inauguration . Peaked at 58k Tweets sent per minute at 12:02pm EST. pic.twitter.com/bmqg1jdU8w
